result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane J Skoglund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:03 Defendant Shane J Skoglund in court with attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak.  Defendant Shane J Skoglund in custody.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Zell states that parties agree that Dr. Galli should conduct another competency evaluation and asks that competency hearing be reset. 
Court calls Dr. Galli and he feels he would not need to do another evaluation. 
Court questions defendant regarding his competency. He states he feels he is competent.
Attorney Zell and Attorney Nolan Plutchak will not present any evidence that defendant is not competent.
Court finds defendant competent to proceed.

10:07 Defendant Shane J Skoglund in court with attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak.  Defendant Shane J Skoglund in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Nolan Plutchak states that a psychiatric evaluation was done and it was concluded that defendant is not competent. She requests additional competency evaluation. 
Court orders that Attorney Nolan Plutchak submit her psychiatrist report to the Court and also a copy to Dr. Galli so Dr. Galli can decide whether he wants to do another evaluation.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
